title: eHaus Live Webinar
bodyText:
Thinking of building? This free webinar: Building the Passive House Way, is not to be missed!

The eHaus difference lies at the very heart of our homes and we invite you to learn about the mechanics of these healthy, comfy, high performing homes and the eHaus process.

We will explain the key Passive House principles and how these are applied to the design and build process. You'll also learn about the incredible health and comfort benefits you can expect from your eHaus.

There will even be a Q&A session at the end, so come prepared to ask your questions and hear from our experts.

Registrations closed
When: Wednesday 26th July at 7pm

title: International Passive House Open Days
bodyText:
We are opening our doors on three eHaus projects for the International Passive House Open Days.

The International Passive House Open Days are a great opportunity to learn about Passive House and energy efficient buildings. Learn first-hand what it is like to live in a Passive House and what the building process was like. Enjoy the comfortable interior temperatures, take a look at the ventilation system, ask questions and consider the possibilities of Passive House for your own building projects.

You can visit the following eHaus projects:

590 Brunswick Road, Whanganui: Open 2.00-4.00pm, Saturday 24th and Sunday 25th June 2023.

Havelock North: Open 1.00-4.00pm, Saturday 24th June 2023. Bookings are required, please contact Sharon at sharonw@ehaus.co.nz or 027 721 9324 for the address.

Toiora High Street Co-housing Project, 11/25 Alva Street, Dunedin: Open 1.00-3.00pm, Sunday 25th June 2023. Bookings are required, please email Tim Ross tim@architype.co.nz

title: Waikato pop-up show home
bodyText:
Welcome to the stunning home located in the contemporary Greenhill Park subdivision of Hamilton. This exceptional home has recently been completed by the eHaus Waikato team and is now open for viewing, but only for a limited time.

This exceptional property showcases a harmonious blend of Abodo cladding and brick achieving a timeless yet modern look. Boasting an open-plan layout seamlessly connecting the living, dining, and kitchen areas, which effortlessly flow out to a covered outdoor living space. The residence also features three bedrooms and a separate media room, providing the perfect setting for relaxation and entertainment. Constructed to eHaus Pacific standard, this home features a Zehnder MHRV System to provide fresh, filtered air and high levels of insulation throughout to keep it warm.

To experience an eHaus first hand and to appreciate how an eHaus is different from standard homes, the eHaus Waikato team invites you to visit this pop-up show home. The show home is available on weekdays throughout September 2023, from 9am to 3pm. Additionally, for those with busy schedules, we're more than happy to accommodate weekend viewings by appointment. To arrange a viewing, please contact Laura on 027 363 6833 or laura.jacobs@ehaus.co.nz

title: Thinking about building a new home? Join our eHaus live webinar!
bodyText:
Learn how eHaus design and build NZ’s healthiest, comfiest, highest performing homes at our free webinar on 17 January. The eHaus difference lies at the very heart of our homes and we invite you to learn about the mechanics of these incredible homes along with the eHaus process.

In this practical session Jon Iliffe, co-founder and director of eHaus, will share valuable insights, including:

  • Active versus passive heating: Explore the differences of active and passive heating methods, understanding how they impact the energy efficiency of your home.
  • The state of current New Zealand housing: how mould and condensation can cause an unhealthy home.
  • Our performance options: The eHaus Euro and eHaus Pacific are setting a new standard for living that we think every Kiwi deserves.
  • Health, comfort, and energy savings: Learn about the unique elements that set eHaus homes apart from the ordinary, and the unparalleled health and comfort benefits, along with significant energy savings, that come with residing in an eHaus.
  • Our flexible design options and what an eHaus can look like: Choose from The Peoples House Collection of build-ready plans or start with a blank canvas and collaborate with our designHaus to create a bespoke home, unique for you.
  • Our sustainability story: We live like our environment is a privilege and protecting it our responsibility.

We invite you to participate in a Q&A session at the end. You can either submit your questions when you register or feel free to put your questions in the message box during the live event.

Event Details:

Date: Wednesday, 17 January

Time: 7:00-8.00 PM

Registrations are now closed. If you would like a copy of this webinar, please email jon@ehaus.co.nz.

title: Join our FREE webinar to discover what's shaping the building industry in 2024 & why it's a good time to build.
introSection: Join our FREE webinar to discover what's shaping the building industry in 2024 & why it's a good time to build.
bodyText:
Everyone is well aware that the NZ building industry has been through a few interesting years. Coming out of Covid in 2021 saw a huge shift, mostly caused by the lowest mortgage rates ever seen in NZ and a building boom, followed by material prices increasing and product shortages. It was a turbulent time, but just as quickly as things turned tough, the good news is that the building industry is changing again.

Here at eHaus we are starting 2024 with confidence and zest following the recent release of new industry research and data, along with our own insights developed over the last 14 years of business.

Join our FREE webinar on Thursday 15 February from 7-8pm and discover why we believe it is a good time to embark on your building journey. In this engaging session, we'll delve into the factors shaping the building industry in 2024 and how eHaus is navigating the landscape this year. In the webinar we will explore:

✅ Prices for building materials and price certainty

✅ How annual housing consents are tracking and the impact on builders' capacity

✅ Predicted changes for inflation and mortgage rates

✅ Property values and the CoreLogic House Price Index

If you plan to build a new home, don’t be put off by the turbulence of 2020-2023. The market has changed, and we will guide you through how building in 2024 is possible.

There will also be a Q&A session at the end. You can either submit your questions when you register or feel free to ask Jon any questions during the live event.

Don't miss this interactive opportunity to gain valuable insights into the building industry's dynamics in 2024.

When: 7-8pm, Thursday 15 February, 2024

title: Don't settle for ordinary. Join our free webinar to discover how you can achieve outstanding architecture without sacrificing the performance, health, or comfort.
introSection: Don't settle for ordinary. Join our free webinar to discover how you can achieve outstanding architecture without sacrificing the performance, health, or comfort.
bodyText:
Don't settle for ordinary when it comes to your home's architecture. Join us on Thursday, March 14 from 7-8pm for our latest webinar where we'll explore how you can achieve outstanding architecture without sacrificing the performance, health, or comfort of your home. We're excited to interview Nick Officer and Ben Jagersma from our designHaus, who will share their insights on creating homes that are not only beautiful but also enriching to live in.

Ben, Director, Design Manager & Architect at First Light Studio, believes that architecture can change the world for the better with designs that are not only beautiful but also healthy, uplifting, playful, and effective at connecting us to our environment and each other. Meanwhile, Nick, Director & General Manager at First Light Studio, is passionate about solving real problems through architecture while never compromising on the pursuit of beauty.

There will also be a Q&A session at the end. You can either submit your questions when you register or feel free to ask the team any questions in the chat field during the live event.

📅 Date: Thursday, March 14

🕖 Time: 7-8pm

Click here to register and secure your spot today!

title: Breath of fresh air: Join our free webinar with Katheren Leitner to discover the impact indoor air quality has on our health
bodyText:
Respiratory conditions accounts for one in eleven of all hospital stays in New Zealand costing $6.7 billion every year and is the third leading cause of death. One in eight children and adults have asthma in New Zealand, with damp, cold and unhealthy housing conditions a key contributor to these statistics.

In May we celebrate World Air Quality Week and World Asthma Day. Both initiatives are designed to educate and raise awareness of air pollution, air quality and the risks to respiratory disease sufferers.

To continue that conversation, we will be hosting our next webinar with Katheren Leitner, Strategic Advisor and ex-Chief Executive at Asthma NZ, to discuss the importance of living in a healthy environment.

Join our free webinar on Thursday 9 May 2024 from 7-8pm where we will explore:

  • The impact indoor air quality has on our respiratory health
  • The problem with polluted air, moisture, and mould
  • How eHaus design and build with air quality and health in mind, reducing pollutants by 98% and removing moisture from inside homes

We will hear from Katheren on her learnings from her role of Chief Executive at Asthma NZ and the Healthy Homes A Kiwi Dream series.  

There will also be a Q&A session at the end. You can either submit your questions when you register or feel free to ask Jon and Katheren any questions during the live event.

Join us for what will be an interesting webinar!

Registrations have now closed

title: Busting Myths: Demystifying eHaus and Passive Houses - Free Webinar 6 June
bodyText:
It's time to separate fact from fiction and discover the truth about sustainable, energy-efficient living in an eHaus.

Join us for a free webinar on Thursday 6 June from 7-8pm as we debunk common myths surrounding eHaus and Passive Houses. Led by our industry experts, we'll challenge preconceptions and provide clarity on what it truly means to live in an eHaus.

  • Myth #1: You can't open windows.
  • Myth #2: eHaus’ are airtight and can't breathe.
  • Myth #3: Passive solar and Passive House are the same thing.
  • Myth #4: eHaus' are ugly.
  • Myth #5: All eHaus' are Passive Houses.
  • Myth #6: Insulating the floor isn't important.
  • Myth #7: Passive Houses work best in cold European climates.
  • Myth #8: eHaus' are expensive.
  • Myth #9: You don't need any heating in an eHaus.

Our team will address each myth head-on, providing evidence-based insights and real-world examples. Whether you're looking to build, or are simply curious about how we build comfy, high performing homes, this webinar is for you.

Don't miss this opportunity to gain valuable insights and dispel myths about eHaus and Passive Houses. Reserve your spot today!

Event Details:

📅 Date: Thursday, 6 June 2024

🕖 Time: 7-8pm

Registrations have now closed.

title: Come in from the cold with the eHaus Experience! Visit our homes across NZ on 15 & 16 June 2024
bodyText:
Tour our healthy, comfy, and high performing homes with The eHaus Experience! Join us on 15 and 16 June as we open the doors to many of our innovative eHaus’ across the country. This exclusive event offers an opportunity for you to experience an eHaus and learn how our homes are warmer, healthier, and higher performing than conventional houses.

What to expect:

Inspiring homes: Step inside our custom-designed homes and experience firsthand the eHaus difference. From innovative building materials to energy-saving technologies, each eHaus is a testament to our commitment to sustainable building and architectural excellence.

Speak with our team: Our knowledgeable team will guide you through each home, providing insights into the design principles, construction techniques, and sustainable features that make eHaus a leader in building innovation.

Expert advice: Have questions about energy efficiency, sustainable design, or the components we use to build an eHaus? Our team will be on hand to share their expertise and offer recommendations for your own building projects.

If you are thinking of building a new home, then take hold of this opportunity to tour an eHaus and speak with our team about how our homes are different from conventional homes.

Registrations:

To visit any of these homes, please register by emailing the local team member listed next to each location. For privacy reasons, we don't publish the address online and you’ll receive the address once you’ve registered. Please note we have many homes open around the country, and each region has a different person to register with.

Photos may be taken during these events for marketing purposes. If you don't wish to have your photo taken, please let the team know.

*Please note these three locations are working construction sites and all practical steps have been made to ensure your safety while on site. Please be aware of any hazards around you and take the necessary actions to avoid them. Closed in shoes are necessary and children must be supervised at all times.

Follow us on Facebook or Instagram for the latest news and updates about The eHaus Experience.

title: Waiting for the right time to build? Join us and economist, Jarrod Kerr, on why starting your build now makes sense.
bodyText:
Join us on 17 October from 7-8pm for our free webinar with Kiwibank Chief Economist, Jarrod Kerr, as we discuss the improving outlook for New Zealand’s economy and the building industry.

With the recent change in our Official Cash Rate, the decrease in mortgage rates, and a shift in consumer confidence, we’ll provide exclusive insights into why starting your design and build now makes sense.

In this engaging session, we'll delve into the factors shaping the New Zealand economy and we will explore:

✅ Prices for building materials and price certainty
✅ How annual housing consents are tracking and the impact on builders' capacity
✅ Changes in the OCR, inflation and mortgage rates
✅ Property values and the CoreLogic House Price Index

There will also be a Q&A session at the end. You can either submit your questions when you register or feel free to ask Jon or Jarrod any questions during the live event.

Don't miss this opportunity to gain valuable insights into why starting your build now makes sense.

Date: 17 October 2024

Time: 7.00 - 8.00pm

Registrations now closed.

bodyText:
Join Steve Hofmans from eHaus Taranaki at the Sustainable Builds Tour and Talk on Wednesday, 13 November, for an exclusive look inside a certified Passive House. Held at a local eHaus project in Egmont Village, this event offers a unique opportunity to learn what sets a Passive House apart from a standard home. Steve will cover key aspects of Passive House construction, focusing on insulation, ventilation, and the energy-efficient design that defines these homes.

Following the talk, homeowner Lucinda Searle will guide you through her home, sharing her experience of living in a Passive House and the benefits it brings.

title: Webinar: eHaus vs code minimum - the eHaus Advantage
bodyText:
Building a home to the minimum New Zealand building code won’t be as dry, warm, or energy efficient as an eHaus. Join us in our last webinar for the year to discover how eHaus’ substantially outperform homes built to the Building Code.

We'll explain the core elements that make eHaus stand out—from airtightness and superior insulation to energy savings and carbon reduction.

You’ll also hear from eHaus customers who already enjoy the comfort, health benefits, and cost savings of living in an eHaus.

Don’t miss your chance to learn why you really can live better in an eHaus!

title: Want a home that outperforms the rest? Join our free webinar to find out how!
bodyText:
Join our free webinar on 23 January to discover how we design and build New Zealand’s healthiest, comfiest, highest performing homes.

At eHaus, we set the standard for better living, and we invite you to learn about the mechanics of these incredible homes. In this practical session, Jon Iliffe, co-founder and director of eHaus, will share valuable insights into the eHaus difference.

What you’ll learn:

  • Active versus passive heating: Understand the key differences between heating methods and how they influence your home’s energy efficiency.
  • The state of New Zealand housing: Why mould, condensation, and poor design create unhealthy homes—and how eHaus provides the solution.
  • eHaus performance options: Discover how the eHaus Euro and eHaus Pacific are redefining what’s possible for Kiwi homes.
  • Health, comfort, and energy savings: Learn how living in an eHaus means unparalleled comfort, a healthier indoor environment, and significant energy savings.
  • Flexible design options: Choose from The Peoples House Collection of build-ready plans, or start with a blank canvas and collaborate with our designHaus to create a bespoke home, unique for you.
  • Our sustainability story: Because we believe our environment is a privilege, and protecting it is our responsibility.

Plus, ask us anything. We’ll wrap up with a live Q&A session. You can submit your questions when you register or send them through during the event.

Registrations now closed.

title: Why do homes overheat? Join our webinar to find out how we design & build to eliminate that risk
bodyText:
Are you concerned about new homes overheating? You're not alone. Recent media coverage and government updates to the H1 Building Code have highlighted these issues, but many of the proposed changes still miss the mark.

By November 2023, the final tranche of MBIE’s changes to the H1 Building Code were in effect. While these updates aimed to make homes more energy efficient, little thought was attributed to managing solar gain in the summer which created an over-heating problem. Ventilation was not adequately considered either, contributing to poor air quality and moisture damage.

At eHaus, we know the real problem isn’t too much insulation or high-performing windows—it’s a lack of understanding about how to design homes for year-round comfort.

In this webinar you will learn about the building science that makes it possible to design and build a comfortable, healthy home no matter where it is built in the country. We’ll explore how:

  • Homes can maintain a comfortable temperature all year round.
  • Fresh, filtered air and no condensation are achievable with good design.
  • Energy modelling during the design stage ensures your home avoids overheating and moisture risks.

This approach allows us to predict the risk of overheating with a high degree of accuracy and eliminate any risk at the design stage.

We’ll have a Q&A at the end, and you can submit your questions when you register or send them through during the event.

📅 Date: Thursday, 20 February

🕖 Time: 7-8pm

Registrations have now closed.

title: PHINZ Event: Build better with Passive House
bodyText:
In collaboration with Passive House Institute NZ, we invite you to join the Build better with Passive House event on 12 March in Methven and Ashburton. Maria Rei, from the eHaus Head Office, along with Martin Smith, from eHaus Christchurch, are presenting at the event to show the importance and process of building better homes.

Whether you're a seasoned professional or just curious about better building practices, this event is perfect for anyone interested in building better. Don't miss out on this opportunity to gain valuable insights into the future of construction.

Event format

1. eHaus site visit – Forest Drive, Methven

2. Seminar – Ashburton Council, 2 Baring Square East, Ashburton.

Seminar format

Site visit 15:00

1. Introduction and builder experience – Martin Smith from eHaus Christchurch

2. Home owner experience - Why choose a better performing house

3. Supplier - Tamia Osikai from MaxRaft (insulated foundations)

4. Supplier - Cam Kilgour from Fantech (ventilation supplier)

5. Look around and drinks.

Leave at 16:00 for Ashburton Council.

Seminar 16:30

1. Introduction by Mike Farrell - Technical Leader Building Consents

2. What is a Passive House by Karen Manson PHINZ Board member

3. Architectural Design of Passive Houses by Elizabeth Guthrey from Design & Make Architects

4. Energy Modelling for Passive Houses by Maria Rei from eHaus

5. Structural Engineering for Passive Houses by Damien McGill from The Healthy Home Cooperation

You need to register for this event here.

title: Free webinar: Don't settle for ordinary architecture
bodyText:
Don't settle for ordinary when it comes to your home's architecture. Join us on Wednesday, 17 September from 7-8pm for our free webinar where we'll explore how you can achieve outstanding architecture without sacrificing the performance, health, or comfort of your home. We're excited to interview Tim Ross from our designHaus, who will share his insights on creating homes that are not only beautiful but also enriching to live in.

Tim is the director and founder of Architype. He is a highly experienced registered architect with over 20 years of practice working on a range of project typologies and sizes both in New Zealand and overseas.

Tim is passionate about designing elegant, climate friendly buildings which provide healthy, comfortable environments for their occupants. He is able to weave aesthetic and technical requirements together from the concept stage to create highly buildable and efficient designs.

There will also be a Q&A session at the end. You can either submit your questions when you register or feel free to ask the team any questions in the chat field during the live event.

📅 Date: Wednesday, 17 September

🕖 Time: 7-8pm

Click here to register and secure your spot today!

title: Manawatu Open Construction Event - 19 & 20 Sept
bodyText:
Our difference lies at the very heart of our homes, and we’re inviting you to experience this healthy, comfy, high-performing home in Palmerston North before it's finished. You will be able to see the mechanics behind this special home, and talk with our Manawatu team about building the eHaus way.

If you are thinking of building a new home, then take hold of this opportunity to tour an eHaus while it's still under construction to learn how our homes are different from standard homes.

Private appointments only.

Day: Friday 19 and Saturday 20 September 2025

Location: Palmerston North*

Click here to select your appointment time and register.

*For privacy reasons, we don't publish the venue address online. Register for full address details.

Please note this is a working construction site and all practical steps have been made to ensure your safety while on site. Please be aware of any hazards around you and take the necessary actions to avoid them. Closed in shoes are necessary and children must be supervised at all times. Photos may be taken during this event for marketing purposes, if you don’t wish to have your photo taken please let the team know.

title: Waikato Home & Garden Show | 2-5 October
bodyText:
Join us for the Waikato Home and Garden Show

Visit eHaus Waikato at the Waikato Home and Garden Show to discover how we design and construct beautifully efficient homes that perform significantly better than those built to the minimum building code, while consuming less energy and reducing carbon.

Day: Thursday, 2 October - Sunday, 5 October: 10.00am to 5.00pm

Location: Stand 309, GLOBOX Arena & Events Centre, Claudelands, Hamilton

Get tickets here.

We look forward to seeing you at the show!

title: eHaus Waikato Information Evening | 14 October
bodyText:
Following the Home and Garden Show our team of experts will be hosting a special Information Evening along with Craig, who has recently moved into his eHaus. The eHaus difference lies at the very heart of our homes and we invite you to learn about our beautiful high-performing homes in more detail.

If you are thinking of building a new home, then take hold of this opportunity to talk to our eHaus team about building a sustainable eHaus.

Day: Tuesday, 14 October

Time: 7.00pm

Location: Hamilton. Full address details supplied once registered.

Save your seat and receive the address by emailing: laura.jacobs@ehaus.co.nz
